Of course! Based on your preferences, I would recommend "To Have and Have Not" (1937) starring Humphrey Bogart and Lauren Bacall. This classic romantic drama follows a American expatriate who helps transport a French Resistance leader and his wife to Martinique while falling in love with a sensuous lounge singer. The movie features witty dialogue, sultry atmosphere, and a memorable performance by Bogart.

Alternatively, if you're looking for something more recent, I would suggest "Divergent" (2011) starring Shailene Woodley and Theo James. This dystopian sci-fi movie is full of action, suspense, and intriguing characters. It follows a young woman who discovers she's Divergent, a person who doesn't fit into any category, and must navigate a dangerous world where conformity is the norm. The movie features stunning visuals, an engaging plot, and a talented cast.
